channel.title: VB help. Thanks
channel.description:
Hey, I've made a program in Visual Basic.
First;
I know how to code it but when i want something to display on a new line i add [code]& Environment.NewLine[/code]
But i have a red line under NewLine, Maybe i need to import something.
If so What?
Second;
How do i chahnge the Icon of my program. I have a file with .Ico but it says it can'ts do something.
Help = Rep++

item.title: VB help. Thanks
item.dc:creator: @austinsobes austinsobes
item.description:
@austinsobes wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:7, topic:391610”][quote author=Saphire` link=topic=488771.msg3573164#msg3573164 date=1303209553]

Class test Public Shared Sub Main() Console.WriteLine() Console.WriteLine("NewLine: {0} first line{0} second line{0} third line", _ Environment.NewLine) End Sub 'Main End Class 'test

Works fine.
[/quote]
You’re writing to a console. He’s using a Windows Form Application.

Also you may want to look here; http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.visualbasic.constants.vbnewline.aspx[/quote]

I didn’t read to the bottom, so I don’t know if you’ve been answered or not. But this is both an answer and a reply. OP is using form apps and attempting to write to a console that wasn’t given an outsourced link or reference. So he is writing to a console that doesn’t exist.

Read full topic

item.title: VB help. Thanks
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“SacredHeart, post:8, topic:391610”][quote author=Evil_ link=topic=488771.msg3573200#msg3573200 date=1303213992]
People still use VB? =/
[/quote]
Well i want to learn C#, But i think it’ll be hard to adapt from Java to C#.

I’m still learning Java.

Also, I’m getting an error with;

It says Constants Must Have A Value, Also. When i get it working how would i use it?;

?[/quote]You’re kidding me right…? Java and C# are basically first cousins.

Read full topic

item.title: VB help. Thanks
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Naw, remove this;
Public Const vbNewLine As String

Change the other line to this;
TextBox1.Text += “Testing” & vbNewLine

If not, just use the Append method.
TextBox1.Text.Append(“Testing”)
TextBox1.Text.Append(vbNewLine)

Read full topic

Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click Me.TextBox1.Text += "Testing" & Console.WriteLine Console.WriteLine("NewLine: {0} first line{0} second line{0} third line", _ Environment.NewLine) End Sub End Class

@SacredHeart wrote:

Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click
Me.TextBox1.Text += “Testing” Console.WriteLine(“NewLine: {0} first line{0} second line{0} third line”,
Environment.NewLine)
End Sub

I’ve got errors.

Help?

Read full topic

item.title: VB help. Thanks
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

Console.WriteLine("NewLine: {0} first line{0} second line{0} third line", _ Environment.NewLine)

The ico file can be changed, just double click on it and you should be asked up upload the ico file you would like too use.

Read full topic
